attributes.action: Lower 2023 A level Grade boundaries and re-grade all A level students fairly.
attributes.additional_details: 2023 A Level Grade Boundaries are ludicrously high, they are considerably higher than pre-covid, (2019), grade boundaries, they fail to take into account that these students did not sit their GCSEs so may lack exam techniques and skills, These results are a record low, with predicted A* students only achieving B grades. Universities are resulting to reducing their entry requirements as not enough students are meeting these requirements.
attributes.background: The Department of Education should force exam boards to lower their grade boundaries in accordance to this year's students abilities and every A Level student should be given new results in line with a more fair and lower grade boundaries.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about grade boundaries are a matter for exam boards, not the UK Government or Parliament.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Ensure fair grading for GCSE and A Level students in 2023 due to strikes: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/636929
